Events that occurred on 8 April

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1893 - Vincent Trought, a member of the T.C.B.S., is born.
1932 - C.S. Lewis recommends his brother Warren in a letter to read J.R.R. Tolkien's translation of The Owl and the Nightingale.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 59a.
1956 - Voice actor Jim Piddock is born.
1958 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letters 206 and 207.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 285.
1966 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Roger Verhulst.
1969 - Actor Ian Hughes is born.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 2510:
Eorl the Young and the Éothéod travel towards the Field of Celebrant.
T.A. 3019:
The Ring-bearers Samwise and Frodo are honoured on the Field of Cormallen.
